Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Fuzz \Fuzz\ (f[u^]z), v. t. To make drunk. [Obs.] --Wood. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fuzz \Fuzz\, n. [Cf. Prov. E. fuzzy that ravels (of silk or cotton), D. voos spongy, fungous, G. faser filament. E. feaze to untwist.] Fine, light particles or fibers; loose, volatile matter. [1913 Webster]
{Fuzz ball}, a kind of fungus or mushroom, which, when pressed, bursts and scatters a fine dust; a puffball. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Fuzz \Fuzz\, v. i. To fly off in minute particles. [1913 Webster]

fuzz n 1: filamentous hairlike growth on a plant; "peach fuzz" [syn: {hair}, {tomentum}] 2: uncomplimentary terms for a policeman [syn: {bull}, {cop}, {copper}, {pig}] 3: a hazy or indistinct representation; "it happened so fast it was just a blur"; "he tried to clear his head of the whisky fuzz" [syn: {blur}] 4: the first beard of an adolescent boy
